name: European Committee for Homeopathy
legal: international association having philanthropic, scientific and educational aims, registered under the Belgian law of 25th October 1919, modified by the law of 6th December 1954.
goal:
The European Committee for Homeopathy represents medical doctors, pharmacists, veterinarians and agronomists specialized in homeopathy, organized in 40 associations in 28 European countries. It is aimed at

- promoting the scientific development of homeopathy;
- ensuring high standards in the education, training and practice of homeopathy by registered health professionals;
- harmonising professional standards in homeopathic practice across Europe;
- providing high-quality homeopathic care in a safe medical context;
- integrating high-quality homeopathy into European health systems.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Consumers, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Public Health, Single market
